content:
@Josh Triplett are you tagging with this new (?) label where you'd like the nomination to be specific for T-compiler, correct?
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=label%3AI-compiler-nominated

is this label for general use? should I take it into account when handling issues/pr nominated for T-compiler discussion?
@apiraino That's the intention yes. The goal is to migrate away from the generic I-nominated, but that doesn't have to happen quickly.
We've had a number of cases where an issue is labeled for multiple teams and then has "I-nominated", and it isn't clear which team is supposed to look at it in their meeting.
understood, makes sense! :thumbs_up: thanks
The idea of splitting the label came up in the meetings of several teams, and everyone in each of those meetings was favorable, so I figured I'd go ahead and try it. :)
I think this is a good addition.

However: I don’t think we need to migrate 100% from I-nominated, in the sense that I wouldn’t want us to eventually delete the label. Here’s why: Because I think there are scenarios where the person doing the nomination doesn’t know which team is the the right one, and I don’t want such people to have to spend a lot of time asking themselves that. I think during the process of triage, the teams themselves can figure out which team is the right one, and revise the choice of labels accordingly.

Does that make sense to you, @Josh Triplett ? Or do you think that anyone who is doing nominating should be taking the time to figure out which team they’re directing the nomination at? (A viewpoint that I think I just talked myself into being willing to consider…)

@pnkfelix I personally think someone doing a nomination should know which team they're asking. If they don't know which team to ask, they could ping multiple teams via GitHub @ and ask which one(s) should address it.

I don't want items ending up on team meeting agendas just for whichever team whose meeting happens first to end up taking meeting time to say "oh, this should be for this other team" and change the labels.
That can happen async.
(I don't have any objections to a label that someone volunteers to triage into one of the nomination labels, but someone has to actually be willing to do that triage regularly.)

I'll note that currently I-nominated can only be set by team members (i.e., not just anyone) via rustbot - part of the intent was to encourage nomination with enough context to hopefully permit productive discussion. Unfortunately that doesn't often happen anyway, but I think to me that suggests I-nominated isn't that useful. @Josh Triplett I think your additions have not updated the configuration for triagebot, though, so that's probably an oversight to correct.

Folks can still directly nominate for multiple teams, too, with multiple labels, so it doesn't seem like a problem to me.
@simulacrum I wanted to make sure that teams had the opportunity to update their agenda-generator scripts first.
(Does anyone have permission to invoke rustbot to add I-nominated who doesn't have permission to set labels directly?)

Yes, wg-triage and wg-prioritization at least can do that and I think lack the GitHub rights to directly set labels.

But I don't understand your perspective, can you elaborate? What has changed from before that it makes sense to permit access now and didn't before?

Yes, wg-triage and wg-prioritization at least can do that and I think lack the GitHub rights to directly set labels.

Ah, I didn't realize. I had thought those groups could set labels directly.

But I don't understand your perspective, can you elaborate? What has changed from before that it makes sense to permit access now and didn't before?

I don't think I understand the question you're asking. I wasn't proposing to make any permission change, other than the obvious migration of rustbot permissions from I-nominated to I-*-nominated. Anyone who could set I-nominated before should be able to set I-*-nominated.
@Josh Triplett but you haven't made those rustbot changes?
Currently rustbot is configured such that I-* can be set by anyone, but I-nominated cannot (by explicit opt-out)
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/triagebot.toml#L9
So by adding labels you've explicitly changed who can nominate
Oh! I didn't realize that it was an opt-in opt-out like that.
I had thought any tag not explicitly listed wasn't permitted, so I was assuming the new tags weren't permitted yet.
I'm not proposing such a permission change.
Can you fix the configuration (via PR), then?
:+1:
@simulacrum https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/90129
r+'d, thanks
